title: We Need An Autistic Champion

embed.description: Early behavioral, cognitive, or speech interventions can help children with autism gain self-care, social, and communication skills. Although there is no known cure, there have been reported cases of children who recovered. Not many children with autism live independently after reaching adulthood, though some become successful.

body:
Magic The Gathering has recently confirmed their newest Plainswalker, Narset as being on the autistic spectrum. In response to this I feel that the League, should also have a champion that autistic individuals, like my self, can identify with.

Champions such as, {{champion:86}} , {{champion:1}} , {{champion:24}} ,{{champion:11}} ,{{champion:20}} ,{{champion:133}} ,{{champion:33}} , and {{champion:50}}  come close to properly representing  our autistic brothers and sisters, but don't quite fit the cigar.

I was thinking that this autistic champion should be a top laner, that way he or she would not have to deal with a stressful social environment, until team fights start. or he or she could be like {{champion:75}} , or {{champion:23}} that way he or she would not have to deal with the stressful social environments at all!

I was hoping that we could have an open discussion about a new autistic champion!

I would like to point out that Rek'Sai had no real way of communicating that she wanted to be in the League in the first place, her only noises being roars/screeches, so every time she's in a game it's really just her randomly finding a fight and deciding she wants to join in, which is also her basic playstile - jumping into whatever fight she feels like (as a jungler, typically neutral monsters, further supporting the idea that she just happened to be in the area at the time that the fight started) and chasing down anyone who tries to get away. Not all champions necessarily had to ENTER the League of Legends to begin with, so it's possible that one day an autistic champion just entered the fight because he felt like it and wouldn't listen to anyone who told him no. He didn't have to be the strongest that his region had to offer, he just had to decide that he was gonna go in and fight.
either way if they where autistic there passive would have to be something like this "Autism-- refuses to follow commands 70% of the time and returns to base every 5m regardless of summoner commands"
How does this differ from the behavior of bronze players currently? What's the catch?
